Sentence.sentence: Why, then, has this claim become so popular?Part of the answer is that this is what always happens during periods of high unemployment—in part because experts and analysts believe that declaring the problem deeply rooted, with no easy answers, makes them sound serious.
The commission's revised Green Guides warn marketers against using labels that make broad claims, like eco-friendly.
So what you need to know is that there's no evidence whatsoever to back these claims.
So the evidence contradicts the claim that we're mainly suffering from structural unemployment.
Marketers must qualify their claims on the product packaging and limit them to a specific benefit, such as how much of the product is recycled.
Manufacturers of products that claim to be environmentally friendly will face tighter rules on how they are advertised to consumers under changes proposed by the Federal Trade Commission.
It's kind of a Wild West, anybody can claim themselves to be green.
In the last five years or so, there has been an explosion of green claims and environmental claims.

David Mallen, associate director of the Council of Better Business Bureau, said in the last two years the organization had seen an increase in the number of claims companies were bringing against each other for false or misleading environmental product claims.
Companies have also taken it upon themselves to contest each other's green claims.

And that, fundamentally, is why claims that we face huge structural problems have been multiplying: they offer a reason to do nothing about the mass unemployment that is crippling our economy and our society.
The other thing is that a lot of these supplements aren’t necessarily what they claim to be, and you really have to be wary when you take any of them.
He spoke out against the idea of white and black as distinct groups, claiming that these distinctions  ignored the scope of human diversity.
Most notoriously,Oprah's validation of jenny McCarthy's claim that vaccines cause autism(自闭症)has no doubt contributed to much harm through the foolish avoidance of vaccines.
They are also hoping the court's ruling will rein in patent law, which is increasingly being used to claim new life forms as private property.
University officials claim that they dole out iPhones and iPods so as to facilitate students' learning outside of class.
Thecompany claims its motives are essentially public-spirited.
Google claims its plan for the world's biggest online library is to serve the interest of the general public
Supporters of home education claim that it is less expensive and far more efficient than mass public education.
We seek it out in others and are proud to claim it in ourselves, perhaps even more than good looks or intelligence
We can perhaps claim compensation from the steel suppliers for failure to deliver on time.
Claim compensation from the steel suppliers
You claim you are traveling on a scholarship from Delhi University.
"I’ve seen very expensive protein supplements that claim to be high quality but they might not really be beneficial for the average healthy adult," she says.
Sentence.come: 2019年12月六级真题（第二套）阅读 Section B

Sentence.sentence: The other thing is that a lot of these supplements aren't necessarily what they claim to be, and you really have to be wary when you take any of them.
Sentence.come: 2016年6月六级真题（第二套）听力 Section B

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均有"要求，请求"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: ask, beg, demand, require, request, implore, claim, pray, entreat
means: ask ：最普通用词，指向对方提出要求或请求，长、晚辈，上下级之间都可使用。
beg ：指恳切地或再三地请求或要求，常含低三下四意味，也多用于应酬场合。
demand ：一般指理直气壮地提出强烈要求，或坚持不让对方拒绝的要求。
require ：强调根据事业、需要或纪律、法律等而提出的要求。
request ：正式用词，指非常正式，有礼貌的请求或恳求，多含担心因种种原因对方不能答应的意味。
implore ：书面用词，着重指迫切、焦急或痛苦地恳求或哀求，常含较强的感情色彩。
claim ：指有权或宣称有权得到而公开提出的要求。
pray ：语气庄重，指热情、诚恳和敬祈的要求，现不很常用。
entreat ：泛指一般"恳求或哀求"，含企图说服对方或用热烈的请求软化反对意见的意味。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均含有"断言，声称"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: assert, affirm, allege, maintain, testify, claim
means: assert ：主观意味强，指自认为某事就是如此，而不管事实如何。
affirm ：侧重在作出断言时表现出的坚定与不可动摇的态度。
allege ：多指无真凭实据，不提供证据的断言或宣称。
maintain ：与assert近义，但前者指坚决维护某种主张或观点。
testify ：多指在法庭作证，庄严地宣称自己所说属实。
claim ：可与assert换用，但语气弱一些，侧重指行为自己的权利提出要求他人承认。

stems_affixes.word_buile: declaim[[v.朗诵;谴责]]→n.慷慨演说;雄辩
proclaim[[v.公布;声明]]省鷑.宣告;宣言
ac一再+claim呼喊,叫喊→一再喊→欢呼
pro在前+claim呼喊,叫喊→在前面喊→公布
re回+claim呼喊,叫喊→喊回来→收回来,引申为开荒

word_mean: 在工程承包合同执行过程中，由于合同当事人双方的某一方负责的原因给另一方造成经济损失或工期延误，通过合法程序向对方要求补偿或赔偿的活动。

Sentence.sentence: It's about time they had to be registered and insured, so when they do hit a pedestrian or a vehicle, or cause an accident, at least they can be treated and there might be an opportunity to claim.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语湖南卷 阅读理解 阅读A 原文

Sentence.sentence: Tube bosses claim that capacity was limited because so few people wanted to walk up—meaning only one side was used at all times.
Sentence.come: 2016年高考英语上海卷 阅读理解 阅读D 原文

Sentence.sentence: But some observers are skeptical, “There is a kind of false precision being hawked by people claiming they are doing ancestry testing,” says Trey Duster, a New York University sociologist.
The Bilski case involves a claimed patent on a method for hedging risk in the energy market.

Curbs on business-method claims would be a dramatic about-face, because it was the federal circuit itself that introduced such patents with is 1998 decision in the so-called state Street Bank case, approving a patent on a way of pooling mutual-fund assets.
Sometimes years are required for truly novel discovery claims to be accepted and appreciated.
Similar to newly staked mining claims, they are full of potential.
Once a discovery claim becomes public, the discoverer receives intellectual credit.
Now the company is suddenly claiming that the 2002 agreement is invalid because of the 2006 legislation, and that only the federal government has regulatory power over nuclear issues.

Not surprisingly, newly published discovery claims and credible discoveries that appear to be important and convincing will always be open to challenge and potential modification or refutation by future researchers.
In the end, credibility “happens” to a discovery claim - a process that corresponds to what philosopher Annette Baier has described as the commons of the mind.
Consequently, discovery claims should be thought of as protoscience.
But, unlike with mining claims, the community takes control of what happens next.
But it takes collective scrutiny and acceptance to transform a discovery claim into a mature discovery.

As a discovery claim works it through the community, the interaction and confrontation between shared and competing beliefs about the science and the technology involved transforms an individual’s discovery claim into the community’s credible discovery.
Another urge or need that these gardens appear to respond to, or to arise from is so intrinsic that we are barely ever conscious of its abiding claims on us.
In effect, the White House claimed that it could invalidate any otherwise legitimate state law that it disagrees with.
Every Justice rightly rejected this remarkable claim.
“Those first few days should be spent looking for work, not looking to sign on,” he claimed.
Symbolic of national unity as they claim to be, their very history—and sometimes the way they behave today – embodies outdated and indefensible privileges and inequalities.

As a discovery claim works its way through the community, the interaction and confrontation between shared and competing beliefs about the science and the technology involved transforms an individual's discovery claim into the community's credible discove
Sentence.come: 2012年考研真题（英语一）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

Sentence.sentence: In the end, credibility "happens" to a discovery claim - a process that corresponds to what philosopher Annette Baier has described as the commons of the mind.
Sentence.come: 2012年考研真题（英语一）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

Sentence.sentence: Next time you state your position, formulate an argument for what you claim and honestly ask yourself whether your argument is any good.
Sentence.come: 2020年考研真题（英语一）翻译 Section Ⅲ

Sentence.sentence: This practice was justified by the claim that women were needed at home, and it kept juries unrepresentative of women through the 1960s.
Sentence.come: 2010年考研真题（英语二）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

Sentence.sentence: You may proudly claim to only have frozen peas in the freezer-that's not good enough.
Sentence.come: 2013年考研真题（英语二）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

sentences.en: They claim to have discovered a cure for the disease.
sentences.cn: 他们声称已经发现了治疗此病的一种药物。

sentences.en: He claimed himself to be engineer.
sentences.cn: 他声称自己是工程师。

sentences.en: A small terrorist group has claimed responsibility for the bombing in London.
sentences.cn: 一小撮恐怖分子已经声称伦敦的爆炸事件是他们干的。

sentences.en: The flood claimed hundreds of lives.
sentences.cn: 水灾夺走了数百人的生命。

sentences.en: There are several matters that claim my attention.
sentences.cn: 有几件事值得我注意。

means.word_mean: 要求(应得权利)；要求给予

sentences.en: Every citizen may claim the protection of the law.
sentences.cn: 每个公民都可以要求受到法律的保护。

means.word_mean: 要求承认(权利、所有权等)；声称有权，拥有；索取，认领

sentences.en: Does anyone claim this luggage?
sentences.cn: 有人认领这件行李吗?

sentences.en: I claim payment from my friend.
sentences.cn: 我要求我的朋友付款。

sentences.en: His claim to own the house is valid.
sentences.cn: 他主张对此屋的所有权有效。

sentences.en: You have no claim on my sympathies.
sentences.cn: 你无权要求得到我的支持。

means.word_mean: （尤指对财产、土地等要求拥有的） (应得的)权利；所有权，要求权
（尤指向公司、政府等）(根据保险政策、赔偿法等)要求的付款；索款、索赔

jx.jx_en_mean: a reason for being regarded as unusual or noteworthy
jx.jx_cn_mean: 与众不同之处，值得注意之处；成名的原因

lj.lj_ly: the town's only claim to fame is that it is the birthplace of Elgar.
lj.lj_ls: 小镇所以成名的惟一原因是它是埃尔加的出生地。

lj.lj_ly: She laid claim to her father's crown.
lj.lj_ls: 她根据权利要求继承父亲的王位。

jx.jx_en_mean: To assert one's right to or ownership of.
jx.jx_cn_mean: 坚持对…的权利或对…的所有权

entry.def: If you say that someone claims that something is true, you mean they say that it is true but you are not sure whether or not they are telling the truth.

example.ex: He claimed that it was all a conspiracy against him...
example.tran: 他声称这一切都是一场针对他的阴谋。

example.ex: A man claiming to be a journalist threatened to reveal details about her private life...
example.tran: 一个自称是记者的人威胁要公开有关她的私生活的细节。

entry.def: A claim is something which someone says which they cannot prove and which may be false.

example.ex: He repeated his claim that the people of Trinidad and Tobago backed his action...
example.tran: 他再次声称，特立尼达和多巴哥的人民支持他的行动。

example.ex: He rejected claims that he had affairs with six women.
example.tran: 他拒不承认他和6个女人有染的说法。

entry.def: If you say that someone claims responsibility or credit for something, you mean they say that they are responsible for it, but you are not sure whether or not they are telling the truth.
entry.tran: 声称(负有责任或享有功劳)

example.ex: An underground organisation has claimed responsibility for the bomb explosion...
example.tran: 一个地下组织已经声称对这起炸弹爆炸事件负责。

example.ex: He was too modest to claim the credit.
example.tran: 他太谦逊，不愿意邀功。

entry.def: If you claim something, you try to get it because you think you have a right to it.
entry.tran: 索取，索要(有权拥有的东西)

example.ex: Now they are returning to claim what was theirs.
example.tran: 如今他们回来索取本属于他们的东西。

entry.def: A claim is a demand for something that you think you have a right to.

example.ex: Rival claims to Macedonian territory caused conflict in the Balkans.
example.tran: 多方主张拥有对马其顿的领土主权，结果在巴尔干地区引发了冲突。

entry.def: If someone claims a record, title, or prize, they gain or win it.
entry.tran: 取得，获得，赢得(纪录、冠军或奖励)

example.ex: Zhuang claimed the record in 54.64 seconds...
example.tran: 庄创下了54.64秒的纪录。

example.ex: Steffi Graf claimed a fourth Wimbledon title in 1992.
example.tran: 施特菲·格拉芙于1992年第4次赢得温布尔登桂冠。

entry.def: If you have a claim on someone or their attention, you have the right to demand things from them or to demand their attention.

example.ex: She'd no claims on him now...
example.tran: 现在他不欠她什么了。

example.ex: He was surrounded by people, all with claims on his attention.
example.tran: 他被人们团团围住，个个都要他把注意力放在自己身上。

entry.def: If something or someone claims your attention, they need you to spend your time and effort on them.
entry.tran: 需要，要求(花时间或精力)

example.ex: There is already a long list of people claiming her attention.
example.tran: 需要她关注的人已经很多了。

entry.def: If you claim money from the government, an insurance company, or another organization, you officially apply to them for it, because you think you are entitled to it according to their rules.

example.ex: Some 25 per cent of the people who are entitled to claim State benefits do not do so...
example.tran: 有权申领政府补贴的人当中，约有25%没有提出申请。

example.ex: John had taken out redundancy insurance but when he tried to claim, he was refused payment...
example.tran: 约翰办理过失业保险，可是当他去索赔时却遭拒付。

entry.def: If you claim money or other benefits from your employers, you demand them because you think you deserve or need them.
entry.tran: (向雇主)索要，索取，讨要(钱、福利)

example.ex: The union claimed a pay rise worth four times the rate of inflation.
example.tran: 工会要求按照通货膨胀率的4倍提高工资。

entry.def: If you say that a war, disease, or accident claims someone's life, you mean that they are killed in it or by it.
entry.tran: (战争、疾病、事故)夺去(生命)，导致(死亡)

example.ex: The civil war claimed the life of a U.N. interpreter yesterday...
example.tran: 昨天，内战夺去了一位联合国译员的生命。

example.ex: Heart disease is the biggest killer, claiming 180,000 lives a year.
example.tran: 心脏病是头号杀手，每年夺去18万条生命。

entry.def: Someone's claim to fame is something quite important or interesting that they have done or that is connected with them.

example.ex: Barbara Follett's greatest claim to fame is that she taught Labour MPs how to look good on television.
example.tran: 芭芭拉·福利特最出名的事就是她教工党议员如何在电视上拥有良好形象。

entry.def: If you lay claim to something you do not have, you say that it belongs to you.

example.ex: Five Asian countries lay claim to the islands.
example.tran: 5个亚洲国家声称对那些岛屿拥有主权。

means.word_mean: 1. an assertion of a right (as to money or property);
2. an assertion that something is true or factual;
3. demand for something as rightful or due;

sentences.sentence: "they struck in support of their claim for a shorter work day"
"a strong legal claim to the property"
"he had no documents confirming his title to his father's estate"

means.word_mean: 6. a demand especially in the phrase "the call of duty"
1. assert or affirm strongly; state to be true or existing;

sentences.sentence: "He claimed that he killed the burglar"

means.word_mean: 2. demand as being one's due or property; assert one's right or title to;

sentences.sentence: "He claimed his suitcases at the airline counter"
"Mr. Smith claims special tax exemptions because he is a foreign resident"

means.word_mean: 3. ask for legally or make a legal claim to, as of debts, for example;

sentences.sentence: "They claimed on the maximum allowable amount"

means.word_mean: 4. lay claim to; as of an idea;

sentences.sentence: "She took credit for the whole idea"

means.word_mean: 5. take as an undesirable consequence of some event or state of affairs;

sentences.sentence: "The hard work took its toll on her"

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Old French claime (noun), clamer (verb), from Latin clamare 'call out'

means: 声称
索取
赢得
需要
夺去（生命）
声称，主张
权利
索赔

sentences.cn: 来自纽约大学的社会学家特洛伊·迪斯特说，“那些声称自己正在做家谱鉴定的人们所宣扬的（祖先鉴定）精确度其实是虚假的。”
sentences.en: “There is a kind of false precision being hawked by people claiming they are doing ancestry testing,” says Trey Duster, a New York University sociologist.

sentences.en: Now the company is suddenly claiming that the 2002 agreement is invalid because of the 2006 legislation, and that only the federal government has regulatory power over nuclear issues.

sentences.en: In effect, the White House claimed that it could invalidate any otherwise legitimate state law that it disagrees with.

sentences.cn: 他声称，“失业后最初的那几天应该用来找工作，而不是用来办理失业登记。”
sentences.en: “Those first few days should be spent looking for work, not looking to sign on,” he claimed.

sentences.cn: 虽然他们声称自己是民族团结的象征，但是他们的历史和他们现在偶尔的行为举止，还是体现了过时的、不合理的特权及不平等的现象。
sentences.en: Symbolic of national unity as they claim to be, their very history—and sometimes the way they behave today – embodies outdated and indefensible privileges and inequalities.

sentences.en: For one trial, each participant was shown a pile of pens that the researcher claimed were from a previous experiment.

sentences.cn: 你可按你的保险索赔你遗忘在火车上的大衣。
sentences.en: You can claim on your insurance for that coat you left on the train.

sentences.cn: 约翰办理过失业保险，可是当他去索赔时却遭拒付。
sentences.en: John had taken out redundancy insurance but when he tried to claim, he was refused payment...

sentences.cn: 你方的索赔须有足够证据支持.
sentences.en: Your claim should be support by sufficient evidence.

sentences.cn: 我们要求将上述货物的索赔时间期限延长到7月5号.
sentences.en: We request to extend the time limit for claim on the above shipment to July 5.

sentences.cn: 建筑业是一个索赔多发的行业.
sentences.en: Architecture is a trade in which engineering claims occur frequently.

sentences.cn: 如果伤害是因非标准治疗引起, 你可以提起医疗事故之索赔主张.
sentences.en: Should an injury result from nonstandard practice, a malpractice claim for damages could be made.

sentences.cn: 我们有足够的证据提出索赔.
sentences.en: We have substantial evidence for lodging a claim.

sentences.cn: 由于货物重量短缺,我们必须向你方提出索赔.
sentences.en: We must submit our claim for a shortage of goods.

sentences.cn: 我们有必要向你们提出索赔.
sentences.en: We must lodge a claim with you.

sentences.cn: 这是短重索赔.
sentences.en: This is a claim on shortweight.

sentences.cn: 我顺路来你们自己搞是为了处理索赔疑难题目的.
sentences.en: I were question toto your company on my way habitat order to settle the claim.

sentences.cn: 改变某事以适合新情况, 尤指对保险索赔的计算和清算.
sentences.en: To change something to fit new condition, especially to calculate and settle an insurance claim.

sentences.cn: 1我认为你们应当向保险公司提出索赔, 因为责任在他们身上.
sentences.en: I think you should ask claim from the insurance company, because it's the duty.

sentences.cn: 你方的索赔缺乏足够的证据, 因此根据站不住脚.
sentences.en: Without sufficient evidence to support, your claim is untenable.

sentences.cn: 这项索赔属保险公司责任范围, 我们不能对此负责.
sentences.en: The claim should be referred to the insurance company. We cannot hold ourselves responsible for it.

sentences.cn: 你可以就受损货物向保险商索赔.
sentences.en: You can claim for the damaged goods with the underwriter.

sentences.cn: 我方现向贵方索赔,赔偿我方的化肥短缺.
sentences.en: We are now lodging a claim against you for the shortweight of fertilizer.

sentences.cn: 在行李丢失后,航空公司收到了几百项索赔要求.
sentences.en: The airline received hundreds of compensation claims following the loss of the luggage.

sentences.cn: 经再三考虑, 我们决定放弃索赔.
sentences.en: After rethinking, we have decided to withdraw our claim.

sentences.cn: 对不起,我们不能受理你方的索赔.
sentences.en: We regret we cannot admit your claim.

sentences.cn: 您可以将所有文件邮寄到″索赔通知信件″上列出的地址.
sentences.en: You may send all documents by mail to the address listed on your Claim Notification Letter.

sentences.cn: 如果转售商被起诉并被对产品侵犯专利或版权索赔.
sentences.en: If an action is brought against Reseller claiming that a Product infringes a patent or copyright.

sentences.cn: 延期索赔是对卖方么有按时装运货物而提出的索赔.
sentences.en: Claim on delayed shipment is those sellers fail to do the deliextremeccly according to time schedule.

sentences.cn: 你方所提供的索赔证据不充分, 因此我们不能考虑你方索赔要求.
sentences.en: The evidence you have provided is inadequate, therefore we cannot consider your claim as request.

sentences.cn: 警方正在调查伪造的火灾索赔.
sentences.en: The police are investigating fraudulent claims for fire damage.

sentences.cn: 恐怕我们不能接受你方索赔,因为这与我们无关.
sentences.en: I am afraid we cannot entertain your claim as it have nothing to do with us.

sentences.cn: 恐怕我们不得不因包装太差而向你方提出索赔.
sentences.en: I am afraid we have to lodge a claim with you for rough packing.

Sentence.sentence: I've had the idea for some time that Jack Green's been busy stirring things up in connection with the latest wage claim.

Sentence.sentence: New York's Attorney General's office launched an investigation in the fall into whether or not Verizon, Cablevision and time Warner are delivering broadband that's as fast as the providers claim it is.

Sentence.sentence: The results reveal that while Swedes were the tallest people in the world in 1914, Dutch men have risen from 12th place to claim top spot with an average height of 182.5cm.

Sentence.sentence: When your child throws her spoon on the floor for the sixth time as you try to feed her, and you say, "That's enough! I will not pick up your spoon again!" The child will immediately test your claim.
